Technique: FORMED BY HAND; WRITTEN WITH A REED PEN/REED WITH SPLIT NIB
Name: Demotic ostracon
Description: This fragmentary ostracon, which was purchased by J. Capart at Luxor in 1900, bears, on the recto, a column of proper names and the beginning of another column with sums and several words connected with the priestly milieu. The verso only contains several incomplete words. This probably is a temple account.
